meanings.definition: Agons (noun): a public competition or contest in ancient Greece, especially in athletics or literature.
meanings.sent1: The agons in ancient Greece were fierce battles of skill and strength.
meanings.sent2: The annual agons brought together athletes and poets from all over the land.
meanings.sent3: The agons in the city square were filled with cheers and excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her journey through the agons of life was like a marathon with unexpected hurdles.
meanings.sent5: The agons were a test of endurance and talent for all participants.

meanings.definition: Agons (verb): to engage in a struggle or competition.
meanings.sent1: He agons with his inner doubts every day.
meanings.sent2: The two teams will agons for the championship title.
meanings.sent3: She agons with her fear of heights before climbing the ladder.
meanings.sent4: The candidates will agons for the voters' support in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent5: The siblings agons playfully over who gets the last cookie.

meanings.definition: Agons (adjective): relating to or characteristic of a contest or competition.
meanings.sent1: The agons spirit was strong among the participants.
meanings.sent2: His agons nature made him a fierce competitor.
meanings.sent3: The agons atmosphere at the event was electric.
meanings.sent4: She had an agons drive to always strive for excellence.
meanings.sent5: The agons mindset pushed him to train harder than ever before.
